content: The term 'muggle' became popular after its use in which famous book series?

The term 'muggle' became popular after its use in the Harry Potter book series by J.K. Rowling. In the series, a muggle is a person who lacks any sort of magical ability and was not born into the magical world. The term has since been adopted more broadly to refer to someone who is non-skilled or unskilled in a particular context.
